III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff responsibilities
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12207
Section • (3) An agency shall require that social service workers be
Description directly responsible for all the following activities:
• (a) Placing and supervising children in out-of-home
care. Social service workers shall work directly with
the children, their families, and other relevant
individuals and be primarily responsible for the
development, implementation, and review of service
plans for the children and their families.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency foster care worker is not completing
service plan reports and not making efforts towards reunification.
Investigation The Chief Administrator was contacted via telephone on
07/31/24. The Chief Administrator was informed of the allegation.
The Chief Administrator reported the initial service plan (ISP) and
updated service plans (USP) were completed on time. The most
recent USP dated 07/23/24 was completed at the time of a Court
Hearing on 07/29/24 but was not yet approved. The Chief
Administrator provided the contact information for interviewing
agency staff.
The Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 09/24/24.
The Complainant reported a USP and ISP for this case was not
completed during the 07/29/24 Court Hearing. Complainant was
informed that a review of the case file indicates the 05/21/21 ISP
was completed on time and the USP dated 07/23/24 was also
completed on time. The Complainant responded she did not know
about this. The Complainant reported the agency informed her
that an agency supervisor has 14 days to approve the report. The
Complainant reported she did not receive the ISP or USP until
07/29/24. The Complainant also reported the agency did not make
a timely referral for trauma assessments for Foster Child A and
Foster Child B.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed a second time via
phone on 09/24/24. The Chief Administrator reported Staff 1, a
worker recently new to foster care and assigned to the case, is a
2

quality worker. The Chief Administrator reported she has not had
any concerns about the job performance of Staff 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 09/24/24. Staff 1
reported the 07/23/24 USP was submitted to applicable personal
at 3:14pm on 07/29/24, after the court hearing which occurred
earlier that day. Staff 1 reported the agency was expecting the
Prosecuting Attorney on the case to request redactions in the
report to protect the confidentiality of a person involved in the
case. Staff 1 reported that redactions were completed, and the
report was approved by her supervisor and subsequently the
report was provided to the Court and applicable personal.
Staff 1 reported she had begun work on referrals for trauma
assessments for Foster Child A and Foster Child B in April 2024.
Staff 1 reported some delay had occurred due to various
circumstances. Staff 1 reported Easter Seals would not conduct a
trauma assessment on a child younger than age 4. Foster Child A
is age 3. Staff 1 reported she did find that Samaritas would
conduct an assessment for Foster Child A. Staff 1 also reported
the forms she had used to obtain authorization from DHHS had
been revised and she had not known that. Staff 1 reported she
then had to submit the new version of the March 2024 forms. Staff
1 also reported that DHHS authorization signatures took time to
be completed. Staff 1 reported the trauma assessment for Foster
Child A occurred 09/03/24 and for Foster Child B on 09/10/24.
Staff 1 submitted numerous documents addressing her attempts
to secure assessments for Foster Child A and Foster Child B.
The Program Manager was interviewed via telephone on
09/26/24. The Program Manager reported there were no late
reports with this case. The Program Manager reported the
Prosecuting Attorney wanted some redactions on the USP so the
report was not finalized and approved at the time of Court. The
Program Manager reported once the report was approved later in
the day of 07/29/24 all parties received a copy of the USP. The
Program Manager reported she had explained the report approval
process when they were in the Court Hearing.
The Program Manager reported there were some “hang ups” in
getting Foster Childn A and Foster Child B trauma assessments.
The Program Manager reported Staff 1 was diligently attempting
to find an agency that would conduct the assessments. The
Program Manager reported Staff 1 worked to obtain DHHS
authorizing signatures for the assessments. The Program
3

Manager reported Staff 1 is a quality worker and had worked hard
to obtain the assessments for the children.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
• Emails: Numerous emails beginning 04/01/24 through
08/08/24 between Staff 1 and various DHHS staff as well
as Samaritas were reviewed. Documentation indicates
efforts were being made by the agency to obtain
authorization for the assessments as well as locating an
agency who could conduct the assessments for very young
children.
• Case File Review: The case file was reviewed. The case
file documents the 05/21/21 ISP and 07/23/24 USP were
completed on time as well as approval for the reports.
Analysis The case file documents that the 05/21/22 ISP and the 07/23/24
USP were completed on time. The USP was approved by the
supervisor on the day of the 07/29/24 Court Hearing after the
Court recommended redactions and they were completed.
Documentation established Staff 1 was working to obtain trauma
assessments for the children but had experienced a number of
difficulties outside the control of Staff 1.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
The recommendation is for continuance of the regular license.
